snippet: The European Union has begun an investigation into how low-tax nations like Ireland have helped large multinationals like Apple and Starbucks reduce their tax bills by billions of dollars.
abstract: European Union officials announce investigation into how low-tax nations like Ireland have helped large multinationals like Apple and Starbucks reduce their tax bills by billions of dollars; inquiry is part of more forceful approach to counter increasingly sophisiticated tax avoidance strategies by multinational companies.

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and LANDON THOMAS Jr
byline.contributor: Landon Thomas Jr. reported from New York and James Kanter from Brussels. Douglas Dalby contributed reporting from Dublin, and Stephen Castle from London.

lead_paragraph: The European Union has begun an investigation into how low-tax nations like Ireland have helped large multinationals like Apple and Starbucks reduce their tax bills by billions of dollars.

headline.main: Tax Breaks for Apple and Starbucks Investigated by E.U.
headline.print_headline: Tax Deals Are Target of Inquiry in Europe

keywords.value: Fiat Finance and Trade Ltd SA
keywords.name: organizations
